message: I think ctags might do what you want: see http://vim.wikia.com/wiki/Browsing_programs_with_tags

I'm trying desperately to make vim my default editor and move away from TextMate but I love TextMate's "Go to symbol" functionality. Can anyone recommend a good plugin that also works with Javascript?
would love to see a vimcast on this :) come home @nelstrom! :)
@iain_nl I'd love to see that one too!
it's not a vimcast, still might be useful
alos don't forget, that you can set with m[a-z] a mark and jump to it with '[a-z]
check out https://github.com/carlhuda/janus it has command t and other great tm features
Peruse ":help tags" for a very thorough and clear overview of how to set up tags

Hi, I've implemented the Go to Symbol feature for Vim here: https://github.com/travisjeffery/Go-to-Symbol-for-Vim
Take care.
cscope is quite a bit better than ctags: http://cscope.sourceforge.net/

@raylu No, they each have a set of features that the other doesn't or does much better. Here's a good comparison: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/934233/cscope-or-ctags-why-choose-one-over-the-other
Yes, but the question is about going to a symbol, not completion. "cscope -Rb" should generate the cscope file; you shouldn't need to worry about file types.
